alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Walworth; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:28PM CDT until March 31 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN WALWORTH...WESTERN RACINE...WAUKESHA...SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND WESTERN KENOSHA COUNTIES... At 827 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oconomowoc to near Wheatland to Barrington, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Waukesha, New Berlin, Brookfield, Muskego, Whitewater, Pewaukee, Hartland, Jefferson, Mukwonago, Delafield, Elm Grove, East Troy, Paddock Lake, Wales, Camp Lake, Wind Lake, Oconomowoc, Vernon, Twin Lakes, and Ottawa. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Wisconsin. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
